body_html:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/8637/files#diff-e2d5a00791bce9a01f99bc6fd613a39dR282

Apparently I missed that part when I rolled the change forward. You actually want to remove the action_env that you might set anywhere in that script unconditionally because if the user reconfigure he doesn't want to have stale entry in that file.

Maybe we should just do an "%import .action_env.bazelrc" and wipe that file out and put all the action env in it. That would simplify the sed code.

Apparently I missed that part when I rolled the change forward. You actually want to remove the action_env that you might set anywhere in that script unconditionally because if the user reconfigure he doesn't want to have stale entry in that file.
Maybe we should just do an "%import .action_env.bazelrc" and wipe that file out and put all the action env in it. That would simplify the sed code.
body:
https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/8637/files#diff-e2d5a00791bce9a01f99bc6fd613a39dR282

Apparently I missed that part when I rolled the change forward. You actually want to remove the action_env that you might set anywhere in that script unconditionally because if the user reconfigure he doesn't want to have stale entry in that file.

Maybe we should just do an "%import .action_env.bazelrc" and wipe that file out and put all the action env in it. That would simplify the sed code.
